documents.document: @KeirRice of course, the response to both must be clear in its intent - to prevent fuckery wherever possible. (2/2)
@KeirRice oh, i think it depends hugely on which person you're talking about. education will help incompetence, not maliciousness. (1/2)

@kamal_hothi oh gods, and there's the quicksand blog and writing stuff. * sigh * it's why i've decided to ++ reduce paid hours/day job...
@ok_lyndsey :D (Apols: I think my default stance as non-dev is defensive of still having value) @kamal_hothi
@kamal_hothi let alone keeping abreast of international and local stuff, sleeping and occasionally exercising :P
@kamal_hothi of course! It's a matter of having time - day job + GovHack (almost a full time job) + civictech group I organise + GovWorks...
@ok_lyndsey I have 1 hashtag with "data" in it :) @kamal_hothi
@ok_lyndsey @kamal_hothi (I play a bit with code/tools/data viz, but not at that level :P) I do community-building stuff too.
@kamal_hothi * sigh * Wishing (once again) I had those skills :)
@lightweight of course i'm not! /looks irritated. Hence asking to move this convo - we agree in principle, but words matter.
@lightweight suggest we have this convo in a better medium - twitter terrible for this sort of thing :)
@lightweight Govt is part of it, but of course not all. That would be absurd .
@lightweight esp wrt to some of the elitism it implies. One doesn't need to be clever to make change, nor does it rest in the hands of a few
@lightweight i know, and I agree - I just don't love the term or some of what it implies :) Tweeting prolly not great for that debate.
.@babycommie666 @pepperraccoon @glsignal @colinmegill this just makes me think of Bryan from Spaced :) https://t.co/fAC5X1WFps
@lightweight but yes - breaking issues into goals, and then sorting short, medium and long-term actions is deffo critical :)
@lightweight I don't think we need to "hack culture" - allowing and encouraging discourse would be a great start.
@lightweight Agreed! We need firm goals, though, rather than more ethereal concepts, if that tipping point is to happen/work :)
I've seen this a lot: experts abdicating their responsibility & pushing it onto non-experts, while blaming them for being non-expert :( #rpt

@LinkedIn ok, using a different browser and several tries, i got in and changed pword. please check your systems - VERY weird happenings.
@LinkedIn Ummmm. And yeah - can't do a single thing as your system won't recognize my email addresses or pword (but… https://t.co/LFFCk30LnC
@LinkedIn WTF? I can't reset my password (won't recognise my email address), can't sign in on mobile, but I AM also signed in on desktop??!
@LinkedIn - why has my account summarily disappeared? And my email addresses no longer register on your system?
